results.title: The Gas turbine
results.creator_credit: Peter De Normanville and Shell Film Unit
results.brief_description: The gas turbine is a heat engine, the simplest and smoothest running yet devised. All heat engines burn fuel, change a small part of the heat produced into energy, and waste the rest through the exhaust. In the gas turbine, rushing torrent of hot high-pressure exhaust gas is the turbine’s source of power.

results.title: The Gary Crew video
results.creator_credit: Mark Waters, Christine McCaul Gleitzman and Insight Profile
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Insight profile”.
Gary Crew explains how he developed the ideas behind his award winning novels. He takes you back through his childhood and early life to the buildings and landscapes which were the inspiration for the settings of many of his books. He explains how the right ‘setting’ for a novel is as important as a good storyline, and how to develop any place, no matter how boring, into something special.

results.title: The Garden of Gujurat
results.creator_credit: Mohan Wadhwani, Ezra Mir, Documentary Films of India and UNICEF
results.brief_description: More than 20,000 farmers and their families were eking a bare existence in the Kaira District of India. Through a modern milk plant, contstructed with the co-operation of UNICEF, the Food and Agriculture Organisation, the Government of India, New Zealand (under the Colombo Plan) and their own co-operative, scores of communities are benefiting, as well as the thousands of school children who are receiving daily rations of safe milk.

results.title: The Gap
results.brief_description: From dawn one morning until dawn the next day, a man in deep despair tries to end his life by jumping off “The Gap”, a cliff at the mouth of the Sydney Harbour. The entrance is one of mixed and dichotomous meanings, as it is the gateway to a majestic city as well as a place of unutterable sadness where people go to die. Two cops are sent to talk him down. The man outdoes them in his dignity and his courage.

results.title: The Game is up!
results.creator_credit: John Tutty, Meg Labrum and National Film and Sound Archive of Australia
results.brief_description: The National Film and Sound Archive has drawn on its unique film collection in a selection of vintage newsreels, home movies, advertisements and feature film footage looking at women’s contribution to Australia’s sporting culture. The video is accompanied by an excellent teacher resource guide. Presented in chronological order some of the highlights include Annette Kellerman’s underwater ballet in 1914, Vera James in the classic film of 1921, ‘A Girl of the bush’, The Australian Women’s Cricket team of 1937 and of course the golden girls of the Melbourne Olympics of 1956.

results.brief_description: An animated film which deals with the problem of how to cope with playing by the rules and with those sho do not abide by the rules. Suitable for middle and upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: The Game
results.creator_credit: George Kaczender, John Kemeny and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: This is the boy-meets-girl game, but played without rules and at a time when the boy must prove himself in the chase. It is about the much-discussed sexual behavior of teenagers and shows that often the game starts with a challenge to his masculine ego from the boy’s peer group. Few adults are seen or heard from, nor does the film take sides in this game. A dramatisation.

results.title: The Gamblers
results.brief_description: Refers to bulldozing of earth banks, use of brakes, lowering of blades, adjustment of the machine while in operation, fraying of cables, starting, difficulties with children and so on when using earthmoving equipment. An excellent film for large contracting firms and for others using earthmoving plant.

results.title: The Gambler Dostoevsky
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Risk”.
A play based on Dostoevsky’s novel “The Gambler”. Dostoevsky lived his life on the edge of disaster, financial, political and emotional, and the story is about his gambling and about his loving. Dostoevsky’s widow, Anna, recalls her relationship with this complicated man.
